info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 30 at 7:11PM CDT until April 30 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN MOULTRIE...PIATT...WEST CENTRAL CHAMPAIGN...WESTERN DOUGLAS AND SOUTHEASTERN MACON COUNTIES... At 710 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cerro Gordo, or 9 miles east of Decatur, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported a funnel cloud and visibile rotation. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Hammond around 720 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Bement. This includes Interstate 72 between mile markers 162 and 173. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and east central Illinois. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
